types.name: checkin.created
types.description: Fired when an attendee is checked-in via one of the Tito apps (web, iOS or Android).

types.name: ticket.created
types.description: Fired when tickets are created immediately after a registration is confirmed. Tickets can be unassigned, incomplete or complete at this stage depending on whether it is a single or multiple ticket registration or whether the ticket has required fields or not.

types.name: ticket.completed
types.description: Fired when all required fields like name, email, etc and required questions have been answered.

types.name: ticket.reassigned
types.description: Fired specifically when a ticket is reassigned to someone else.

types.name: ticket.updated
types.description: Fired anytime ticket details are changed, including changes to the email address.

types.name: ticket.unsnoozed
types.description: Fired when a “snoozed” ticket is assigned to someone. When people register tickets but do not want to or can’t assign them straight away they can be “snoozed”.

types.name: ticket.unvoided
types.description: Fired when a voided ticket is returned to a valid state.

types.name: ticket.voided
types.description: Fired when a ticket is changed to a voided state. Free tickets that are cancelled by the attendee will also cause this webhook to fire.

types.name: registration.started
types.description: Fired when a registration is started e.g. after they have selected tickets but before they have filled in any details.

types.name: registration.filling
types.description: Fired as soon as the person registering starts filling in details like name, email, etc.

types.name: registration.updated
types.description: Fired when the registration is updated in the Tito admin area or via the API.

types.name: registration.finished
types.description: Fired as soon as the registration is confirmed, e.g. when payment is complete.

types.name: registration.completed
types.description: Fired when all tickets on a registration have been completed (see the ticket.completed webhook).

types.name: registration.cancelled
types.description: Fired when the registration is cancelled in the Tito admin area or via the API. Free tickets that are cancelled by the attendee will also cause this webhook to fire.
